name: Justin Negip
text: Bishop has by far the best quality/value of any cabinet manufacturer out there. Would highly recommend Bishop Cabinets. We have created some incredible designs using the flexibility of Bishop Cabinets. A great company to work with!

resp.text: Thank you Justin - we are very thankful for our extended family of dealers as well.  Our team gives it their all every day.

name: William mack Bates Jr.
text: It's a well established company, that builds semi custom cabinet's. They have several different options for you to choose from. I'm actually trying to get a job there right now, hopefully I'll get it.

name: Judy Permanente
text: Everything about Bishop Cabinets is excellent.  They offer a wide variety of well built cabinets in all colors, finishes and door styles.  Their staff is professional, knowledgeable and always ready and available to be of any assistance you may need.  They respond promptly, offer top notch customer service and treat you like family.  It's a pleasure doing business with Bishop Cabinets!

resp.text: We are only as successful at what we do because of our Dealers.  You ARE family to our team.  Thank you for your excellent review of our products and services.

name: Margaret Belanus
text: I am very impressed with the responsiveness of the Bishop Cabinet Company. The same day that I contacted Customer Service on-line with a problem, Eric Williams quickly got back to me. After figuring out what we needed, he promised to send replacement parts for free, and contacted our contractor to do the repair - all before the end of that business day! The parts were promptly shipped and the replacement parts were installed as soon as our contractor was able. Amazing!

resp.text: Miss Margaret, thank you so much for the nice review and kind words about Eric.  We wish you a warm and elegant heart of your home.

name: Michael Krautkramer
text: Buyer beware.   We had their custom cabinets installed through our builder and they looked great. But in less then a year a few of them warped.  I called the company and sent some pictures and the rep actually came to my house.  He measured cabinets and assured me I was in good hands.  However that’s the last I saw or heard from him and he has not returned my calls.  The company confirmed he still works there but don’t seem to care.  If your contractor suggests these cabinets say no.

resp.text: Hi Michael, I am sorry, it sounds like the ball got dropped.  Please call our CS team directly at 800-410-2444 to explain the situation and we will look into the problem to ensure we get any warranty items taken care of.

name: Nosmo King
text:
We have Jim Bishop cabinets in our kitchen. We built the house 26 years ago and the cabinets still look new. They are oak with finger pulls. Could be that the finger pulls have allowed us to open the cabinets without actually touching the front surface of the cabinets. So that might be why they still look new. We wipe them down with Murphy’s oil soap about once a year as well. I would buy again without hesitation.
Nosmo

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Nosmo, hope you continue to enjoy your cabinetry for many years to come.

name: Victoria Sherbin (Viki)
text:
As a designer, I just love working with them. David specifically is my go-to contact and he's always just amazing! The cabinets are pricier than others, but the quality is great!
If I've ever needed a part or something was missing, they are quick to fix the issue.
Will continue to use them for my projects!

resp.text: Thank you Victoria for your kind words!

name: Frank Valli
text: Great American made cabinet company that delivers their cabinets complete and on time. All at  affordable prices.

resp.text: Thank you so much Frank!!!

name: Paul McAlary
text: A great company to work with. The Bishop cabinet line is flexible while still being affordable.  The ability to customize in cabinetry sizes, functions, and colors makes this the cabinet line of our customers choose most often.  And great customer service!

name: Holly Balint
text: I've used Jim Bishop Cabinets for over 10 years.  They are a great company to work with and the cabinets are extremely well built as well as the finishing.  As a designer, I know my customers are  getting quality and great value.

name: Elisabeth Schneider
text: This is the worst quality I have ever seen. Poor paint, a lot of scratches. Never again Bishop

name: Jason Holeman
text: Issue settled to satisfaction

name: Maryann Grimes
text: All I did was call to ask a question and the person who answered the phone was very rude. If this is an indication how the business works I would never use them!!

resp.text: Maryann, I am so sorry this occured.  I can assure you this person no longer works for us.

text: Great business

resp.text: Thank you Corey for your kind words!

name: Robett Robinson
text: Excellent work on the cabinets they made for a small house that I was remodeling.

name: Mary Christian
text: We have lived in our Sweet Homes Alabama home by John Griggs for 4 months now.  We cannot overstate how thrilled we are with our new home and the amazing commitment to service that we have received from John and Karla.  As with any newly built home, we needed a few minor adjustments.  In each case we received immediate and highly effective responses from John and his contractors.  John was always available to answer our questions, listen to our concerns and go the extra mile to ensure he delivered on his commitments as well as the success of the project.  If you are looking for someone who is fair, competent, and focused on ensuring a quality home we highly recommend John Griggs!  Jamie and Mary Christian

resp.text: Thank you so very much Mary!! You and Jamie were such a pleasure to work with and made it easy to build an amazing home! We are so honored that you chose us to build for you and happy that you are so satisfied with us and your beautiful home!

name: Janice Cagle
text: Great business! Owner is knowledgeable and experienced! Does excellent work!

name: Joe Harless
text: Great service. Great people. Will use again. Thanks guys for all you did for us. - Joe H.

name: Heath Ferry
text: Nick did an awesome job of refinishing all of the bathroom vanities in my house. His work is superior, professional, and fast.

name: Josh Novak
text: Amazing job from start to finish! Highly recommend this company!

name: Kristin Clark
text: Nothing but GREAT things to say about Brent and his team! From the initial meeting to discuss our ideas and options to a follow-up visit to add something new to our incredibly beautiful new kitchen almost a year after completion, we have been happy with this entire experience! We highly recommend this great company for anything you need done to your kitchen or bath!

resp.text:
Dear Mrs. Clark,
Thank you for leaving such a wonderful review! We are thrilled you loved your experience with DreamMaker Bath & Kitchen. Brent and the team always seek to put our customers first, with your experience and satisfaction being our top priority! Your review reaffirms the hard work we put in each day. Thank you again for your kind words and we look forward to seeing you again.

name: Nicole Newton
text: I have would highly recommend Brent Bailey and his team. The quality of the work and professionalism is unbeatable! Top notch company.

name: Dustin Shannon
text: Not real impressed, I tried calling and contacting them by their website. No answer.... I guess they domg want s customer and money...

name: G Smith
text: This is a new business and the couple want to please.  The service was not exactly what I needed.

name: Shannon Kauderer
text:
Working with Wellborn Forest has been a downright mess. I specifically chose an upper end cabinet company because I wanted everything done correctly the first time, but that is not the kind of quality WF keeps. In short, save yourself the money and go with Lowe's, kitchen remodels will be painful either way.

The long story.

We put in our order months early because we knew there had been issues getting wood due to COVID. They arrived about when their ETA said it would, however one of the particularly custom cabinets was delayed because it was rejected by quality control. The contractor was able to install the rest of the cabinets while we waited, then installed the custom one as soon as it arrived, only to realize it's a completely different color than the rest of our cabinets.

Here's a summary of the issues:
a) Miscoloration on the tall cabinet
b) Miscoloration on the island cabinet
c) Miscoloration on the basecovers
d) Missing the base on one of the drink bar cabinets
e) Missing the sink front tray
f) Crack in the upper drink bar cabinet
g) Misalignment of closed door on upper cabinet

I mentioned these issues to my sales rep who had a representative from WF come to inspect the issues. They showed up an hour earlier than they said they would, which meant that I was running a meeting instead of being able to have a discussion about appropriate fixes for the multitude of issues. After I already stated that I don't normally WFH and had made sure to clear my schedule for the time they arranged it was extremely unprofessional to show up early and then leave before we could go over the issues and fixes together. To be clear, I would have much rather gotten a refund then waiting 6 weeks for new ones, but that possibility was not discussed because the sales person left without talking to me.

After insisting on a itemized list of issues with fixes this was the result:
a) Miscoloration on the tall cabinet - new one would be sent
b) Miscoloration on the island cabinet - covered by decorative panel
c) Miscoloration on the basecovers - new basecover sent
d) Missing the base on one of the drink bar cabinets - paid my contractor to make the base instead of building and sending a new cabinet
e) Missing the sink front tray - new sink tray sent
f) Crack in the upper drink bar cabinet - not integral to stability and covered by decorative panel
g) Misalignment of closed door on upper cabinet - new door to be sent

So, 6 weeks later, the new tall cabinet, basecover, cabinet door, and sink tray to find the following issues. (Anything not mentioned was fine.)

a) Tall cabinet was still the wrong color
e) Sink tray arrived broken
g) New cabinet door was the wrong color and wrong size, it doesn't fit any cabinet in my kitchen

At this point I told my sales rep I wanted a refund for the affected items and was otherwise done with this endeavor. I cook in my kitchen every day, I'd already delayed finishing my kitchen for an extra six weeks due to delays from these cabinets and I was not going to delay finishing the kitchen for any longer.

She said she would contact the WF rep to see about the refund. I followed up two weeks later only to find out that someone put in a new order for another replacement. We had to get that cancelled and after four more weeks we got the refund. Six months later and this chapter of our lives is coming to a close.

name: Isaac Critcher
text:
If you want low quality cabinets at high prices, this is the place to go!
And good luck getting someone to call you back!

name: Rebecca Runyan
text:
Gorgeous cabinets but the overall experience depends on your dealer. My dealer/ installer is top notch. These cabinets need to be leveled and adjusted during install. If your dealer is bad your cabinets will be bad. There are also different levels of cabinetry from a price point and quality. Do your homework on the dealer. Mine pushes for back orders, makes additional custom pieces within the wellborn pieces. Highly recommend Bruce Gatenbein with Homeworx as dealer/ installer.

The only reason I gave them a 4 is due to backorder pieces including fronts and reva-shelf inserts.

name: Li Gig
text: Horrible experience with the company.  A $32K DOLAAR KITCHEN CABINETS WERE AWFUL. PAID FOR THEM IN ADVANCE ON JAN 24TH. IT IS JUNE AND AFTER FOUR TRIES, I STILL FO NOT HAVE QUALITY CABINETS.  THEY DO NOT TESPIND AND TAKE FIRVER. STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMOANY UNLESS YOU WANT INFERIOR, POOR QUALITY cabiners.

name: Amie Tworzydlo
text: Cabinets came in with cracked faces. Some faces not fully attached, my builder had to put time into fixing that. One door came in months late. Other doors came in warped. Drawers were set such that they didn't align with each other down the stack, they're uneven. One of the cabinets was ordered with a pull out pan rack. The rack came separate and didn't fit into the cabinet. Was supposed to be build into it. After it was apparent that we were not going to get a replacement, my husband took it all apart and was able to fix it. They were supposed to get us a new door. A couple items were taken care of, but much of it we were on our own. The dealer stopped taking our calls. It's too bad, because the finish is really pretty, the construction of the boxes is very sturdy. They'd have an amazing product if the assembly and support were better.

name: Katherine Hanners
text: Great place to work. They appreciate their employees at welborn. Perfect hours and the management team is amazing as well. Thanks Tim welborn for the opportunity!

name: Craig Coram
text:
Absolutely terrible cabinets.

Made the mistake of paying top dollar for their cabinets for our over expensive custom build and I don’t have the time to write in this review what all was wrong with them.

Terrible quality, poor construction, poor paint/finish, whites don’t match, numerous construction errors, missing parts, damaged cabinets, replacement doors shipped damaged, replacement doors shipped with improper amount of hinges, shelf pins don’t line up and cause shelf’s to set crooked, drawer fronts are a TERRIBLE design and drawer fronts won’t align easily, drawers don’t close flush.

Avoid at all cost. Big Lots level quality.

name: April Williams
text:
Great place to work in Alexander City!!
Go to work do your job and you have a good job, dont apply if cant be there when expected or you think your gonna do nothing for something!!
All of the supervision are good people to work with!!

name: Rebecca Fortney
text: My kitchen renovation started almost two months ago. I ordered white shaker cabinets, with two sets of cabinets with glass fronts.  The glass front cabinets came unpainted on the inside, so a month later, I am still waiting on replacements. Aside from that, there are multiple defects in both the boxes and the doors. There are paint dings, chips, gauges, pitted paint, and one of the trays on the lazy susan has a large peeling splinter.  Yesterday, one replacement cabinet door arrived, it also had a large peeling splinter on the inside.  I am waiting for a representative from the retailer I used to come out and inspect, and presumably deal directly with WB. I am losing patience and will not be giving two years like some of the people posting here for this to be resolved.

name: Stephanie Hale
text: We have worked with Wellborn Forest for over 10 years.  They have always provided excellent quality and customer service at a competitive price.  Anything produced will have an issue from time to time but when we have had issues they were easy to work with and take care of the issue.  I would highly recommend Wellborn Forest Cabinetry to anyone needing cabinets.

name: Hunter Ebey
text: This is one of the best companies to purchase cabinetry from hands-down.  Their attention to detail and quality exceeds our high standards every time.  On the off-chance there is an issue with any of their products they are Johnny-on-the-spot with their follow-through.  My company has bought over 700 kitchens and baths of Wellborn Forest Products cabinetry over the past 5 years, we have never had a better experience with a vendor.  I tell my customers to "Buy With Confidence" when it comes to choosing Wellborn Forest Products, their cabinetry is built to last a lifetime.

name: April Haggard
text: Quality cabinets at a very reasonable price!  I'm a kitchen dealer and we sell Wellborn Forest and their quality and customer service has been great!  Their prices are mid-range which makes them very competitive and we are very happy with these great quality cabinets!

name: Todd Patrick
text: I have been impressed with the quality of Wellborn Forest cabinets.  You will love having these in your home.

name: Lilly Becker
text:
Exceptional staff that is always willing to go the extra mile to help us with our business needs. Their craftsmanship, quality, skill, and customer service always exceeds our expectations.

Lillian Becker, Office Manager
HCR Cabinets & Countertops

name: Glenn Davis
text: I have owned my Wellborn Forest Cabinets since 2005 and they are still as beautiful as they were when installed. Excellent quality and durability.

name: bruce laroche
text: Not very good, at all.  The maple cabinets (painted arctic white) look good, but they don't work well, at all. I am very, very disappointed.  After having Kraftmaid cabinets at our house in Florida, I was hoping for the same quality.  Nope.  They can't compare to Kraftmaid. If I had known, I would have paid the extra to get much, much better quality.  The lower, large pantry doors came with several dings and scratches. At least 5 of the cabinet drawers had gouges and large indentations, and the doors above the fridge had several dings.  To top it all off, the slow close hardware stinks.  Nothing glides like it should.  The Kraftmaid would just glide beautifully after you gently pushed the drawers. The Wellborn Forest cabinets wiggle as soon as you push them gently, and they hardly move. You have to push the drawers up to the point where the slow close mechanism takes over, which is basically pushing them shut yourself.  That's just unacceptable. Even though they cost less than Kraftmaid, they still were not cheap.  I insisted on American made cabinets and this is what I get.  As I said before, I am very, very disappointed. I would recommend spending the extra money and getting a better American made product, certainly not Wellborn Forest.

name: Carla Thrift
text: If you are tired of paying high prices for cabinets, maybe you need to give them a call. Everyone is very polite and down to earth. Awesome cabinets for lower prices.

resp.text: Thank you Carla! We're certainly proud of our cabinets but especially proud of our customer service team - they are the best.

name: Jeff Hyma
text: Wellborn Forest builds a solid well made cabinet that offers an unbeatable amount of colors and styles. Above all, they stand behind what they make like none of their competitors.

name: Leslie Meczka
text:
While this company may have once been reliable and provided a great quality product, those days are behind them. There aren’t strong enough words to describe the level of frustration and anger I feel toward this company. We began our kitchen renovation in October 2017 and now it’s  January 2019 and cabinets are still arriving in the wrong paint color, poorly packaged (and subsequently damaged), and the paint job is inconsistent and chipping. I've been living with the wrong vent hood for over a year, and faulty paint issues (admitted by WB) that caused paint to flake off of these cabinets from day 1. Even worse, the cabinets are all varying shades of white so they don't match. It is very clear there is no QC process in place given the state of my vent hood that had arrived damaged or the wrong size/style and color all together more than 5 or 6 times now. We continually receive wrong items - such as the completely wrong drawer faces, dishwasher panels, and even after this has been escalated to customer service and the VP of ops multiple times. This has gone on for so long now that it originally delayed our project - even with them knowing the project was being filmed by HGTV - and we couldn't even finish off our kitchen for a few additional months as we waited for product. It’s almost as though they skipped a paint coat on these cabinets and sent them out the door as though acceptable. A few cleanings (without chemicals) later and paint rubs right off! Many had flakes of paint missing upon arrival and still need replaced. We have renovated multiple homes and this is our third kitchen install, yet the most challenging company we’ve ever been forced to work with. We had better longevity and less issues when we used Lowe’s cabinets on our first flip home. Shame on this company for all of the money they’ve cost in labor and heartache along the way, for a lack of compensation as a result, and for STILL not getting it right more than a year later. I would never recommend them. For the $20k we spent on cabinets we absolutely could have gotten a much better product elsewhere that would look better and last longer without all this heartburn.

Update: It's been 2 weeks since I originally wrote this review, and even with getting the rep involved, my cabinet hood arrived yet again with a large paint gouge, it arrived in a semi-gloss rather than the satin, and it was the wrong hood all together. This is the 4th hood, and just one example. It's endless.

Update again: We've received 2 more hoods - same issues. Still not done. I still have mis-matched white colored cabinets, and flaking paint because the paint wasn't applied properly. My next step is to report this company to the BBB for not following through with the product I paid for after admitting faulty paint issues and sending wrong items (vent hood). I want a refund.

I paid the balance of this in November and I wasn't ready for it until April. When I went by the shop to pick up a small piece for the shower, I was advised I still owed the other 50% as they didn't show it paid for.. Thank goodness I had a canceled check to prove I had paid for it. I contacted them and advised they had installed the wrong one.  They said they would call the owner, they have never gotten back to me with any kind of explanation at all.  It is installed with no explanation and no apology. Now it would cost me an extra fortune because I am not living in the house and the plumbers installed all the plumbing which would be another added expense to have it replumbed. An apology would have been nice, or they didn't have enough remanent left, or some kind of an explanation and give me another choice. I had no choice in the matter.  No I would not recommend them for any stone work.  After over 1100.00 for 84 inches, we sent them pictures of what we bought and what we had.  The only contact I have had since was they sent me the warranty with still no explanation whatsoever.   I have never been so disappointed in a company and I will never do business with them again. So my situation is this: live with it for the rest of my life or have a law suit and have the bathroom torn up again which has not even been offered..  I would give them a 1 in review

name: Monique Melton
text:
After I moved in my newly built home in February I became aware that drawers in bathroom cabinets were not included.  In June I was given the phone number for a Legacy representative by the builder's superintendent of the subdivision so that I could order a drawer kit.  On June 15th I call Tim (sorry I do not have his last name) with Legacy.  He gave me the name and phone number of a person in Florida that would place my order.  On June 16th I placed the order and was told it would take 2 to 3 weeks for the kit to come in.  She took all my contact information, name, phone number, email and street address.  The charge went through on my credit card on June 26th.  After 5 weeks (on July 24th) with no word from Legacy I began trying to get in touch with the person that took my order.  During the next week I call 4 times and left 2 voice messages with no results.  At this point I gave up on her and started calling Tim.  On July 27th, I called Tim, explained that I was unable to contact the person I placed the order with and could he help me.  He told me she had been fired, he had been on vacation, was extremely busy but would look into it.  Tim actually called me back about an hour later and said that it appeared the kit was in the warehouse and that he would look for it after lunch.  I did not hear back from him.  On the 28th I tried to call but he did not answer.  On July 30th I called again and Tim told me he had a guy looking for it, that the warehouse is very large.  On July 31st again I called and Tim did not answer.  On August 4th I called Tim and asked if we could get some closure on this transaction.  Tim did not yell at me but raised his voice to give me numerous excuses.  The warehouse is big, they had to fire an employee, another employee was out sick, this is their busy time of year and his last excuse made my jaw drop.  He then told me that this was not his job but he would keep looking in the warehouse at which point I suggested maybe he could order another kit.  He said he could do that but would continue to look in the warehouse.  I have not heard from him since the 4th so am assuming that he has not found the original kit and hoping he has ordered a replacement.

I realize that Legacy Cabinets does not make much if any profit from the sale of one drawer kit.  I understand that the builders that purchase cabinets for multiple houses is where Legacy makes the profits but the rudeness and lack of professionalism has absolutely been uncalled for.  I could have never imagined that ordering one drawer kit could be so difficult.

resp.text: Monique, the final response you described is certainly not the amazing service that we're known for. Our customers deserve clarity and closure, as you described. Please know we're working to get this resolved quickly. -Legacy Cabinets Staff

name: Alfred Barecchia
text:
Have a new house less than 1 year old. Kitchen cabinet doors have issues with noisy doors, etc..Had a company rep here from Legacy with the local support company, answers given by Legacy Rep. contradict each other. Sort of dismissing the company from a bad product line.
Variety of options here are 3 of them.

1. One answer was “WE” could install soft close door hinges, but they can’t, because the cabinet was not designed or sold with that type of hinge, but “WE” as homeowner can replace the hinges to fix the problem at “our cost”.

2. Seems to be a potential problem on where cabinets came from. Directly from manufacturer, stored in a warehouse, exposed to dampness, etc.. so the liability of how, where, what was done with cabinets prior to installing falls on the end buyer, being the owner of the house.

3. Another option is to put silicone in frame, door panel,  this might be done by builder “DR HORTON”.  Since some doors do make noise and some don’t, I asked if they could replace the noisy doors. We were told no guarantee that new doors would be any better.  Don’t understand because we had a bad cabinet door replaced months ago, and had no issues with that door. Guess there is no quality control.

I would retract this review if the problem was correctly resolved. New  doors if that is a option. Guess the best option would be all soft close option.

name: F'allen Nicole
text: Extremely disappointed with the service I received from this company.  They did a poor job installing my cabinets. I recently called to have them come out and fix one of my cabinets being that I am still under warranty. They came out as promised, which was they ONLY positive thing. However, they ordered the wrong cabinet size smh. I called the company to express my concerns because I do not have time to be taking off days from work. (y'all know how it is lol) The "manager" or whoever I spoke with stated they will look into it and contact me back.  Well I never received a call back. To me, that shows a lack of compassion and professionalism, but hey who am I. I am just a new homeowner that just simply wants to have their cabinet doors properly fixed.

resp.text: F'allen Nicole, compassion and professionalism are two qualities we refuse to fall short on. Please give us a call so we can follow up on this matter -- 1 (800) 813-1112.  Best. -Legacy Cabinets Staff

name: cody skinner
text: Great work environment and atmosphere!

name: william b woodard
text: I work there I love the place

name: Greg D.
text:
I hope that people read this before they buy Legacy cabinets because the experience has been, and still is utterly awful. These cabinets are hands down the worst part of our new kitchen and we went down to the studs, so everything is new. So first they showed up four weeks late. Thats another month without a kitchen. Thanks y'all.

They were supposed to be white. Some pieces weren't even painted. Doors were chipped, scratched and gouged. I've replaced numerous parts of the system over the last year just to keep them from looking crummy. They're warping and pulling apart. And good luck with customer service at Legacy - they dont give two you know whats....

Long and short is go ANYWHERE else and buy ANY OTHER CABINET.  These aren't worth the headache. And Legacy should shut that plant down and stop robbing people.

resp.text: Greg, we apologize for the lack of customer service and solution response to your cabinets. We appreciate you taking the time to reach out with this review, and we'll take note of your experience to help us improve in the future. We hope you find what you're looking for. Kindly. -Legacy Cabinets Staff

name: Beth Ann Reed
text: LOVE our cabinets!!!!!!! Got them in slate and they are amazing.

name: Eddie Love
text: Drop and hook in and  out.

resp.text: Thanks for taking a moment to leave this review, Eddie! Please feel free to let us know if we can lend a hand with anything. -Legacy Cabinets Staff

name: Jon
text: Our kitchen was professionally redone and the legacy cabinets have never fit together right, doors are  warped, and the spice rack was poorly designed on such a thin cabinet door. The spice rack continuously pulls the screws out with minimal weight in it. Very disappointed considering the amount of money I spent.

name: Johnny McGrath
text: I am disappointed that I had to give them a star; Google does not allow a 0/5 rating.  These are, without a doubt, the most cheaply and poorly manufactured cabinets that I have ever seen.  I totally expected these to be made in China; I couldn't believe that they are manufactured in the United States.  These people should be ashamed of themselves.

name: Dustin Meadows
text: I work at legacy cabinets

name: Kevin Carr
text: Great company with quality product.  I use them in over 70 homes and tenants are really happy.

name: cathy chappell
text: Very disappointed with Legacy Cabinets, Inc. and their Debut Series.  We were told the Debut was a mid-range (quality) cabinet.  Cabinets doors are made of plywood, staining on cabinets do not match, hardware is very cheap-1/2 doors and 1/2 the draws do not close properly, and end caps (sides of cabinets) are a different wood.  Overall a very poorly made product, very cheep looking and we paid way too much for this product.

name: James Futrell
text: This is the worst cabinet company I've ever worked with. Took 4 weeks for cabinets to come in and then when they got here we had different colors and wrong size cabinet and now it's been a total of 9 weeks since ordered and still don't have the repairs done and they just keep jerking me around

name: Cheryl Hartle
text: Wish that no stars were allowed. Used these cabinets for entire kitchen reno.  Drawer glides were replaced multiple times and I still can't get all the drawers to actually soft close. I need to push them closed. End panels cracked. When supplier recommended "spray painting" rather than replacing, I said there could be no evidence of the repair. There is. Contractor used paint supplied by manufacturer, but now I have spots that look greasy and the end panels are cracked again in the exact spots, plus additional spots. I talked to the company sales rep and he refuses to leave Ohio even though he also is responsible for PA so there was no site visit and view problems / issues. I don't ever want to remodel a kitchen again after this experience and knowing I am stuck with these cabinets until I die is depressing.

name: Neicey Mcneal
text: Easy jobs. Standing 10 out of 10 times.

name: Holli Jones
text: Treat employees very badly. Overworked and underpaid. Extremely racist (must speak Spanish or you're given the worst job). No advancements. Lots of safety violations. Wouldn't recommend this place to an enemy.

name: Marley Gulyas
text: Truck drivers are driving under the influence of drugs. Try spot checking them for once. Your drivers can kill and injure others on the roads. Your company can and will get sued. You are not a company with a conscience for other lives.

resp.text: Marley, we apologize for the negative experience you had with us. The safety of our employees and customers is our priority, and making sure our drivers are qualified and safe to be on the road is necessary to our business. We appreciate you sharing your feedback, and we wish you the best in the future. Take care. -Legacy Cabinets Staff

name: Brett Deweese
text:
Worst cabinet company in the country! I have been a dealer for 2 years. I have never had a kitchen without issues.
We have had to repaint entire kitchens due to poor finish work. The list of issues is to large to list.
Stay clear of Legacy Cabinets!

name: Nicholas Cook

name: Lil' Red Heads

text: They don't do glass - and that was never told to me. So when ordering glass door cabinets - no glass comes ....makes no sense, Ive ordered cabinets multiple times from different companies and have never not received glass with glass cabinets.

name: Susan Johnson
text: Teeter Cabinets is a family business with over 25 years of building custom cabinets. They restored my kitchen with custom made cabinets that were a replica of the ones torn out. Since my home was built in 1948, I wanted to keep the Vintage look. Teeter made the cabinets in their location and then brought them to my home. I was very pleased with the quality of craftsmanship and how the cabinets fit perfectly in my kitchen. Teeter can make modern, updated cabinets; their job here was to keep the historical design and they did it perfectly! The men are very professional and the quality of work can’t be beat. Their shop is in an old church and their craft is surely a gift from God!

name: Jennifer Williams
text: These are beautiful works!!!!

name: katrina taylor
text: Not a bad place to work..some of the lead people & supervisors and team members are very helpful. But it's one line in there that is very dysfunctional!!!..Half train you one day to do a job, then expect you to know what you're doing..people quit ALL the time & walk off the line..pay is not worth it for ALL the work that is required. One person doing sometimes a two people job! Beware: Enter with caution & at YOUR OWN RISK!!..

name: Tara Davis89
text: The summer heat makes it miserably hot in the building.  Although if you can withstand it, the money is damn good.

name: Asia Reeves
text: Great customer. Easy in and out. No contact paperwork system. Love it!!!!

name: Gary Korzec
text: Despite the wet ground, it was quick drop & hook. A little tight manuveurs

name: Arsenic Hotshot
text: Great place! Friendly and dedicated workers. Had me loaded in an hour...

name: Nina King
text: My husband is a truck driver and picked up there today. He was helped by a yard dog named Shawn who was very kind, considerate, helpful, and professional.

text: Came here to pick up a load , usual loading time about 1 hour, ran out of driving hours .they allowed me to take my 10 hours break on their premises .

text: Terrible place to work. I do not recommend. Management aren’t trained to be managers, they make the worst decisions ever about every little thing. They could care less about the employees that work single day. Very unorganized. They lie to you or don’t inform you of anything and the managers are very messy and back and forth on everything they say.

name: Edward Russell jr
text: Great people hard workers. And dang good price.

name: Pixie Lent
text: So far even though they were recommended I've reached out on their website and email with no response. So not impressed.

name: Jeremy Patton
text: Wow, the before and after is such a difference.  They do great work at an affordable price!

name: Kyle Rashley
text: best price/best company

name: Gene Montecchie
text:
These guys are absolute craftsman!  If you've been on the gulf coast long you know there are alot of business that advertise that they offer custom builds.

Go with Coastal Custom if quality and pride of craftsmanship is your thing.  Absolutely one of the best in Gulf shores / Orange Beach area for custom cabinets, built ins, furniture and one off heirloom quality pieces.

You won't be disappointed.

resp.text: Thanks for your high praises, Gene!

name: Gabrielle Mazur
text: I’m a photographer and did photo shoots at several projects of Coastal Custom Woodworking. I’m always blown away buy the quality and beauty of the cabinetry and furniture. I’ve met nothing but happy customers who are pleased to have their new spaces shown off.

name: Cynthia Russell
text: Great job listening to what I want and need,

name: Leah Highgate
text: I went there yesterday with a small task I couldn't do myself. The owner took the time to do the job for me, corrected another problem for me, and didn't charge me a dime! He also explained a few things to me that'll make my basic wood projects easier and more successful. If Kleinschrodt's was that helpful and diligent handling my minor problem, I can only imagine how fantastic they'd be with a big project! What a wonderful experience! THANK YOU!!!

name: ben “Ben Da Cajun” hebert
text: Great old school cabinets. Solid wood Mortise and tenon faces,  Hand made in the USA!

name: Mark Sawyer
text: Really great work! Helped me out tremendously

name: Clay Edwards
text: The place to call for all types of custom cabinetry.
